name: Koffieboontje Hotel

reviews.text: This hotel is in a fantastic location just off the Markt Square next to the Belfry. Everything is just a short walk away you can't fault the location and its close to the guy that sells chips in front of the Belfry so you don't have far to go if you are hungry!
reviews.title: Excellent location average hotel
One to be avoided
reviews.text: The reception area was tiny and not very welcoming and looked similar to the reception areas of hostels. Staff were friendly and helpful even when they gave us the wrong key to the wrong room.

reviews.title: Fantastic Room, Great Location!
reviews.text: The room they had given us the wrong key for was tiny and the door hit the wall before it even opened all the way. When you walked in there was a bunk bed to the left, with a desk and chair opposite with about less than a metre of space between the two. The bathroom door was immediatly behind the entrance door it could only be accessed once the entrance door was closed - that is how tiny it was. It was a cute room but seemed a little impractical for two.

reviews.title: Underrated By Others
reviews.text: We had booked a superior room and it was a lovely room with lots of character, when we got the right key. It overlooked the bar/restaurant next door which wasn't noisy at all. The bed covers are a bit tired and they do let the overall look of the room down. Otherwise it was a pretty nice room for what we paid for. The bathroom was small, clean and modern. However there was no shower curtain so once you had a shower the whole bathroom was soaked through and I'm not sure it was meant to be a wet room!
The corridors in the hotel are narrow and badly lit, the stairs are steep. Which was actually quite off putting and again reminded you of a hostel.
reviews.title: Great location
Great stay
reviews.text: We had a great stay in Hotel Koffieboontje last month. We booked a superior room and we had a great room with a nice view. The hotel is very close to the market square and city center (2 minute walk).

reviews.title: Abysmal Hotel Koffieboontje
reviews.text: We had dinner in the gastronomic restaurant of the hotel and the food and service was excellent.

Have just returned from a weeks xmas market trip, this hotel is ideal if you want to be based in the centre of Brugge. We had a double room, and no smell. Buffet continental breakfast catered for most tastes. Plenty of places to eat and drink within easy walking distance. I would definiately use this hotel again.
reviews.title: Great base for sightseeing

reviews.text: The online description did not in my opinion meet the real description. I believe the online descriptin to be misleading and I would advise people to read all the reviews before booking, I wish I had!
reviews.title: Don't book!
Give this one a miss - dreadful
reviews.text: It was old fashioned, dark and not a very friendly place. The bar was not open once and to be honest we did not find the staff very friendly either. A very disappointing stay for our 23rd Wedding Anniversary.

reviews.title: Not value for money
reviews.text: The car park was a scruffy basement with chipboard for doors. We had to leave the key with reception so they could shuffle our car to make other cars fit. My husband did not rest for the whole time (which was 5 nights) that we were there.

The breakfas was ok, a varied choice and quite a pleasant room. It could do with covers though as on our last day, 50 or so school children were around the table and quite a few had colds. I found this off putting and could not eat.
reviews.title: Got chased out of the room before checkout time.

description: You will find Hotel Koffieboontje right in the centre of Bruges, in a quiet traffic-free shopping street close to the "Grote Markt" (central main market square).In a contemporary architectural environment, you will be staying right in the historical centre of the city, with its unsurpassed sightseeing and shopping options.All rooms have a private bathroom, a telephone, a TV, free WiFi access, a hair-dryer and free coffee and tea making facilities. In the morning you can enjoy our delicious breakfast buffet at no extra charge.For a wide choice of more than 50 Belgian beers, please visit our brasserie "Het Strijdershuis", which also has a large selection of French and South African wines on offer. Here you can chose from a variety of meals: pancakes, snacks, salads and pastas, but also regional dishes and menus.For an alternative lunch or a-la-carte diner, try our restaurant "Kwizien Divien" which offers fine food creations at an affordable price.On sunny days the hotel terrace offers a magnificent view of the Belfry of Bruges.If you are in for some action, you can rent a bicycle from the hotel to explore Bruges and its surroundings.The hotel has an annex building which does not have an elevator. Guest in these quarters dispose of the same hotel facilities as other guests. In addition, they can use bicycles for free during their entire stay.
